# ðŸ§¹ Data Cleaning in R with `dplyr` (Interactive)

In this tutorial, you can run R code directly in your browser using WebR!

## ðŸ“¦ Load the libraries

```{webr}
library(tidyverse)
```

## ðŸ—ƒ Create a messy dataset

```{webr}
df <- tibble::tibble(
  id = c(1, 2, NA, 4),
  age = c("25", "thirty", "40", "35"),
  income = c(50000, 60000, NA, 70000)
)
df
```

## ðŸ” Inspect the data

```{webr}
glimpse(df)
```

## âœ¨ Clean the data

```{webr}
clean_df <- df %>%
  drop_na() %>%
  mutate(age = as.numeric(age))

clean_df
```

## ðŸ§  Summary

In this example, we used:

- `drop_na()` to remove missing rows
- `mutate()` to convert text values to numeric
- `glimpse()` to inspect data structure
